description: Read the latest bulletins and newsletters for taxi and private hire operators

texts: Brent Council is consulting on plans for a new bus lane which includes access for taxis. You have until tomorrow, Friday 28 February, to review the plans and respond to the consultation .
Barking and Dagenham Council is consulting on a new Local Plan . You have until Saturday 29 February to read and comment on the new Local Plan.
Ealing Council is consulting on proposed highway improvements along Greenford Road between Costons Lane and Western Avenue. You have until Monday 2 March to respond to the consultation.

Merton Council has prepared the Future Wimbledon Supplementary Planning document to create a long-term vision for the future of development of Wimbledon town centre. You have until Friday 6 March to review and comment on the document.

The Mayor of London, TfL, and Greenwich and Bexley councils are working together to prepare an Opportunity Area Planning Framework (OAPF) for the Thamesmead and Abbey Wood Opportunity Area. The OAPF documents include a transport strategy and you have until Tuesday 10 March to respond to the consultation.
Westminster Council is consulting on changes in Grosvenor Square . You have until Wednesday 11 March to review the proposed changes and comment on them.

We are consulting on proposed changes along the A202 (Peckham High Street) between the junctions with Basing Court and Mission Place. You have until Thursday 12 March to review the proposals and comment on them.
We are consulting on proposed safety improvements to the A316 London Road roundabout . You have until Thursday 19 March to review the proposals and comment on them.
We are consulting on proposals to transform the A23 Streatham Hill . You have until Sunday 22 March to review the proposals and comment on them.

Camden Council is inviting people to share their views on Camden High Street . This will inform the Camden Town Low Emission Neighbourhood project and you have until Sunday 22 March to complete the survey.
We are consulting on proposed changes on Finchley Road . You have until Friday 27 March to respond to the consultation.

Hackney Council is interested in people's experience of walking, cycling and travelling along Stoke Newington Church Street and in the surrounding area. You can find out more about the project and how to leave a comment on the Stoke Newington LEN website.
Hammersmith & Fulham , Kingston and Sutton councils are inviting comments on where changing points should be in their boroughs.
The following councils are consulting on draft local plans:
• Barking and Dagenham's consultation closes on Saturday 29 February
Find out more about other current TfL consultations .
